- Gout must be treated in view of its associated cardiovascular mortality.

- However, hypouricaemia also carries a risk of increased mortality.

question.title: What is a potential risk associated with untreated hypouricemia in patients with gout?
question.description: A U-shaped curve of mortality risk

option_a.title: Increased mortality due to cardiovascular disease
option_a.description: A well-established risk factor for cardiovascular disease

option_b.title: Increased mortality due to renal failure
option_b.description: A potential complication of untreated hypouricemia

option_c.title: Increased mortality due to both cardiovascular and renal disease
option_c.description: A potential risk associated with untreated hypouricemia

option_d.title: Decreased mortality due to improved treatment outcomes
option_d.description: A benefit of treating hypouricemia in patients with gout
